instruction: How were machine-learning algorithms utilized in the development and validation of Raman metabolic footprint analysis to determine chromosome euploidy and aneuploidy in embryos fertilized in vitro?
Output: Machine-learning algorithms were utilized in the development and validation of Raman metabolic footprint analysis to determine chromosome euploidy and aneuploidy in embryos fertilized in vitro by performing a stacking classification. These algorithms were used to analyze the Raman spectra of spent embryo culture medium samples and classify them as either euploid or aneuploid. The overall accuracy of the stacking classification was 95.9%, indicating that the machine-learning algorithms were successful in correctly assigning the ploidy status of the embryos based on the Raman spectra. The results of the stacking classification were then validated by comparing them to the results of preimplantation genetic testing for aneuploidy (PGT-A) performed by next-generation sequencing.
